description:
As an admin
  I want to manage platform configuration via Parameter Store
  So that I can dynamically adjust pricing, limits, and settings without code changes

steps.name: I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I navigate to the admin configuration page
I should see all Parameter Store values grouped by category
I should see the following categories: "pricing", "session", "mythology", "ai", "shipping"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I request the admin config API filtered by pricing
I should see the following pricing parameters:
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I update parameter "/EpicWeave/pricing/session-fee" to "3.50"
the Parameter Store value should be updated to "3.50"
the change should take effect immediately for new sessions
a config change audit log should be recorded
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I update parameter "/EpicWeave/pricing/custom-tshirt-base" to "25.00"
the Parameter Store value should be updated to "25.00"
new design finalizations should use the updated price
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I update parameter "/EpicWeave/shipping/flat-rate-base" to "7.99"
the Parameter Store value should be updated to "7.99"
new checkout calculations should use the updated rate
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I update parameter "/EpicWeave/session/max-iterations" to "8"
the Parameter Store value should be updated to "8"
new design sessions should allow 8 iterations
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I update parameter "/EpicWeave/ai/image-resolution" to "1024x1024"
the Parameter Store value should be updated to "1024x1024"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I update parameter "/EpicWeave/mythology/allowed-types" to "hindu,greek,norse"
the Parameter Store value should be updated to "hindu,greek,norse"
content validation should accept Norse mythology prompts
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I try to update parameter "/EpicWeave/pricing/session-fee" to "not-a-number"
I should see a validation error "Value must be a valid number for pricing parameters"
the parameter should not be updated
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I try to update parameter "/EpicWeave/pricing/session-fee" to "-5.00"
I should see a validation error "Pricing values must be positive"
the parameter should not be updated
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I am logged in as a regular customer
I try to access the admin config API
I should receive a 403 Forbidden response
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I am logged in as a regular customer
I try to update parameter "/EpicWeave/pricing/session-fee" to "0.00"
I should receive a 403 Forbidden response
the parameter should not be updated

name: Admin Configuration Management

description:
As a platform operator
  I want all pricing to be read dynamically from Parameter Store
  So that I can adjust prices without deploying code changes

elements.name: Session fee is read from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/pricing/session-fee" is "2.00"
I navigate to the design session page
the displayed session fee should be "$2.00"
the Stripe PaymentIntent amount should match the Parameter Store value
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the admin has changed "/EpicWeave/pricing/session-fee" to "3.50"
I navigate to the design session page
the displayed session fee should be "$3.50"

elements.name: Custom t-shirt base price is read from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/pricing/custom-tshirt-base" is "20.00"
I finalize a custom design with front-only placement
the calculated price should be "$20.00"

elements.name: Both-placement surcharge is applied from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/pricing/custom-tshirt-base" is "20.00"
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/pricing/both-placement-surcharge" is "5.00"
I finalize a custom design with both-side placement
the calculated price should be "$25.00"

elements.name: Shipping rate is read from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/shipping/flat-rate-base" is "5.99"
I have 3 items in my cart
I proceed to the checkout page
the shipping cost should be "$9.99"
the calculation should be flat-rate $5.99 plus $2.00 per extra item

elements.name: Max iterations is read from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/session/max-iterations" is "5"
I start a new design session
the session should allow a maximum of 5 iterations

elements.name: Allowed mythology types are read from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/mythology/allowed-types" is "hindu,greek"
I enter a prompt referencing Norse mythology
the prompt should be rejected as invalid mythology type

elements.name: AI image resolution is read from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the Parameter Store value "/EpicWeave/ai/image-resolution" is "1024x1024"
the AI worker generates an image
the DALL-E API should be called with resolution "1024x1024"

name: Dynamic Pricing via Parameter Store

description:
As a registered user
  I want to log in to my account
  So that I can access my profile and make purchases

steps.name: the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I log in with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I should be logged in successfully
I should receive valid JWT tokens from Cognito
the tokens should contain my user ID and email
the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I attempt to log in with email "testuser@example.com" and password "WrongPassword!"
I should see an error "Incorrect username or password"
I should not be logged in
the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I attempt to log in with email "nonexistent@example.com" and password "SomePass123!"
I should see an error "User does not exist"
I should not be logged in
the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I have registered but not verified email "unverified@example.com"
I attempt to log in with email "unverified@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I should see an error "User is not confirmed"
I should be prompted to verify my email
the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I click "Sign in with Google"
I authenticate via Google OAuth
I should be redirected back to the application
I should be logged in with valid JWT tokens
I should be redirected to the dashboard
the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I click "Sign in with GitHub"
I authenticate via GitHub OAuth
I should be redirected back to the application
I should be logged in with valid JWT tokens
I should be redirected to the dashboard
the EpicWeave platform is available
I have a registered account with email "testuser@example.com" and password "TestPass123!"
I am logged in with valid tokens
my access token has expired
I make an authenticated API request
the system should automatically refresh my access token using the refresh token
the API request should succeed

name: User Login

description:
As a new user
  I want to register for an account
  So that I can purchase products and create custom designs

elements.name: Successfully register with email and password

steps.name: the EpicWeave platform is available
I register with email "user@example.com" and password "SecurePass123!"
I should receive an email verification code
I confirm my email with the verification code
my account should be activated
I should be logged in with valid JWT tokens
my user profile should be created in DynamoDB with role "customer"
the EpicWeave platform is available
a user already exists with email "existing@example.com"
I attempt to register with email "existing@example.com" and password "AnotherPass456!"
I should see an error "User with this email already exists"
my registration should fail
the EpicWeave platform is available
I attempt to register with email "invalid-email" and password "ValidPass789!"
I should see an error "Invalid email format"
my registration should fail
the EpicWeave platform is available
I attempt to register with email "newuser@example.com" and password "weak"
I should see an error "Password does not meet security requirements"
my registration should fail
the EpicWeave platform is available
I click "Sign up with Google"
I authenticate via Google OAuth
I should be redirected back to the application
I should be logged in with valid JWT tokens
my user profile should be created in DynamoDB with role "customer"
the EpicWeave platform is available
I click "Sign up with GitHub"
I authenticate via GitHub OAuth
I should be redirected back to the application
I should be logged in with valid JWT tokens
my user profile should be created in DynamoDB with role "customer"

name: User Registration

description:
As a customer
  I want to add products to my shopping cart
  So that I can purchase them later

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the product catalog is available
I am viewing product "Shiva Meditation Tee" with ID "PROD001"
I select size "L"
I select color "Navy"
I click "Add to Cart"
a POST request should be made to API Gateway "/cart/items"
the Lambda should create a CartItem in DynamoDB with:
I should see "Item added to cart" confirmation toast
the cart icon badge should show "1"
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the product catalog is available
I have completed a design session with a custom design
I selected color "Black", size "XL", and print placement "both"
I click "Add to Cart"
a CartItem should be created in DynamoDB with:
I should see the custom design in my cart
the session status should update to "completed"

elements.name: Add multiple quantities of same product

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the product catalog is available
I add product "Zeus Lightning Tee" size "M" color "White" to cart
I add the same product with same size and color again
the quantity should increment to 2
only one CartItem record should exist
the cart total should reflect 2 items

elements.name: Add product that is out of stock

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the product catalog is available
product variant "Apollo Tee" size "S" color "Red" has stockCount 0
I select that variant and click "Add to Cart"
the Lambda should check stockCount > 0
the Lambda should return 409 Conflict
I should see "This product is currently out of stock"
the item should not be added to cart
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the product catalog is available
I add items to my cart
I log out and log back in
my cart items should still be present
they should be retrieved from DynamoDB using PK=USER#<userId>

name: Add Items to Cart

description:
As a customer
  I want to browse pre-designed mythology-themed t-shirts
  So that I can find products I want to purchase

steps.name: the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I navigate to the catalog page
I should see a grid of product cards
each product card should display an image, name, price, and available colors
the images should be served via CloudFront CDN
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
the catalog contains Hindu and Greek mythology products
I select "Hindu" mythology filter
I should only see products tagged with Hindu mythology
the filter should use DynamoDB GSI1 for efficient querying
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I select size "L" filter
I should only see products available in size "L"
out-of-stock sizes should be indicated
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I select color "Navy" from the 30 standard colors
I should only see products available in Navy color
the color selector should display all 30 standard options
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I set price range filter to "$15 - $30"
I should only see products priced between $15 and $30
the results should use DynamoDB GSI2 for category+price queries
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I select "Modern" art style filter
I should only see products with modern art style
I select "Anime" art style filter
I should only see products with anime art style
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I select "Greek" mythology filter
I select size "M" filter
I select color "Black" filter
I should see only Greek mythology products in size M and Black color
the filter count should be displayed
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I have applied multiple filters
I click "Clear All Filters"
all filters should be removed
I should see the full product catalog
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
I am viewing the catalog on a mobile device
the product grid should be responsive
products should display in a single column layout
images should be optimized for mobile
the EpicWeave platform is available
the product catalog contains mythology-themed t-shirts
the catalog contains more than 20 products
I scroll to the bottom of the page
the next page of products should load automatically
the scroll position should be maintained

name: Browse Product Catalog

description:
As a customer
  I want to complete my purchase with payment
  So that I can receive my custom t-shirts

elements.name: Successfully place order with valid payment

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have items in my cart
shipping is configured for US domestic only
I navigate to checkout
I should see my cart summary with all items
I enter US shipping address:
I enter valid payment details via Stripe Elements
I click "Place Order"
the Lambda should read shipping rates from Parameter Store
the Lambda should validate all items are in stock
a Stripe PaymentIntent should be created for the order total
payment is successful
a DynamoDB TransactWriteItems should execute atomically:
I should receive an order confirmation email via SES
I should see the order confirmation page with order number
the order should have status "paid"
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have items in my cart
shipping is configured for US domestic only
I proceed to checkout with valid shipping address
I enter payment details with insufficient funds
I click "Place Order"
the Stripe payment should fail
I should see "Payment failed: Insufficient funds"
no Order should be created in DynamoDB
my cart items should remain intact
I should be able to retry with different payment method
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have items in my cart
shipping is configured for US domestic only
one of my cart items goes out of stock
I click "Place Order"
the Lambda should perform final stock check
it should return 409 Conflict with unavailable items list
I should see "Some items are no longer available"
the unavailable items should be highlighted
I should be prompted to remove them
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have items in my cart
shipping is configured for US domestic only
I proceed to checkout
the Lambda should read "/EpicWeave/shipping/flat-rate-base" from Parameter Store
it should calculate: subtotal + tax + flat-rate + carrier-rate
the order summary should show itemized costs:
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have items in my cart
shipping is configured for US domestic only
I enter a shipping address with country "Canada"
I should see "We currently only ship within the United States"
the Place Order button should be disabled

elements.name: Session fee is NOT refunded when order is placed

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have items in my cart
shipping is configured for US domestic only
I paid a $2 session fee for custom design
I added the custom design to cart
I complete the order
the order payment and session fee payment should be separate records
only the order payment should be eligible for refund

name: Checkout Payment Processing

description:
As a customer
  I want to generate mythology-themed designs via AI (OpenAI DALL-E)
  So that I can create custom t-shirts

elements.name: Successfully generate an image from a valid prompt

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I enter the prompt "Lord Shiva meditating on Mount Kailash"
the system should validate the prompt against content rules
the prompt should be enqueued to SQS for DALL-E generation
I should see a "Generating design..." spinner
the Lambda AI worker processes the SQS message
it should read image-resolution "1024x1024" from Parameter Store
it should call OpenAI DALL-E API with the enhanced prompt
the generated image should be uploaded to S3 bucket "epicweave-designs/<sessionId>/<ulid>.png"
a DesignMessage should be saved in DynamoDB with role "assistant"
the session iteration count should increment to "1 of 5"
I receive the image URL via polling
I should see the generated image displayed on a t-shirt mockup

elements.name: Reject a prompt that does not reference Hindu or Greek mythology

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I enter the prompt "A cool dragon in space"
the Lambda should read allowed mythology types from Parameter Store
the system should reject the prompt
I should see the message "Design must relate to Hindu or Greek mythology"
the session iteration count should not change
no SQS message should be sent
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I have a generated design in the current session
I enter the prompt "Make the background a sunset with cherry blossoms"
the system should generate a modified image within 30 seconds
the iteration count should increment to "2 of 5"
I should see the updated image on the t-shirt mockup
both images should be preserved in the session history
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I have used all 5 available iterations in the session
I try to enter a new modification prompt
the Lambda should return 429 "Max iterations reached"
I should see the message "Maximum design iterations reached (5/5)"
I should be prompted to select color, size, and print placement
the prompt input should be disabled

elements.name: Session expires after 1 hour of inactivity

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
my session was created 61 minutes ago
I try to enter a new prompt
the Lambda should check expiresAt > now
the Lambda should return 410 Gone
I should see the message "Session expired"
the session status in DynamoDB should be "expired"

elements.name: Content safety filter blocks inappropriate prompt

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I enter a prompt with inappropriate content
the content safety filter should reject it
I should see "Content policy violation"
no image generation should occur
the iteration count should not change
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I selected "modern" art style at session start
I enter the prompt "Zeus wielding lightning"
the Lambda should prepend "Create a modern-styled depiction of"
the enhanced prompt should be sent to DALL-E
the generated image should reflect modern art style
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I enter a valid prompt "Ganesha with lotus flowers"
the DALL-E API returns an error
I should see "Image generation failed. Please try again."
the iteration count should not increment
I should be able to retry the same prompt
the session should remain active

elements.name: Select t-shirt color and print placement after accepting design

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have paid the $2.00 session fee via Stripe
I selected "anime" as my art style
I am in an active design session with 5 max iterations
I have accepted a generated design
I select color "Navy" from the 30 standard options
I select size "L"
I select print placement "both"
I should see a price breakdown showing base $20 + surcharge
the finalize endpoint should calculate the price from Parameter Store
I should be able to add the custom t-shirt to my cart

name: AI Design Image Generation

description:
As a customer
  I want to pay a session fee to access AI design generation
  So that I can create custom t-shirt designs

elements.name: Successfully pay session fee and create session

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the session fee is configured at "$2.00" in Parameter Store
I click "Create Custom Design"
I should see the session fee of "$2.00"
I should see terms stating "Session fee is non-refundable"
I should see art style options "Modern" and "Anime"
I select art style "Anime"
I enter my Stripe payment details
I click "Pay and Start Session"
a Stripe PaymentIntent should be created for "$2.00"
the payment is successful
a DesignSession should be created in DynamoDB with:
a Payment record should be saved with type "session_fee" and status "succeeded"
I should be redirected to the chat interface

elements.name: Payment fails due to insufficient funds

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the session fee is configured at "$2.00" in Parameter Store
I click "Create Custom Design"
I select art style "Modern"
I enter payment details with insufficient funds
I click "Pay and Start Session"
the Stripe payment should fail
I should see error "Your card has insufficient funds"
no DesignSession should be created
I should be able to retry payment

elements.name: Payment fails due to invalid card

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the session fee is configured at "$2.00" in Parameter Store
I click "Create Custom Design"
I select art style "Anime"
I enter invalid payment details
I click "Pay and Start Session"
the Stripe payment should fail
I should see error "Your card was declined"
no DesignSession should be created

elements.name: Display session fee from Parameter Store

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the session fee is configured at "$2.00" in Parameter Store
the admin has updated session fee to "$3.50" in Parameter Store
I click "Create Custom Design"
I should see the updated session fee of "$3.50"
the Stripe PaymentIntent should be created for "$3.50"
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the session fee is configured at "$2.00" in Parameter Store
I have an active design session
I attempt to create another design session
I should see message "You already have an active session"
I should be redirected to my existing session

elements.name: Session created with correct TTL for auto-expiry

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
the session fee is configured at "$2.00" in Parameter Store
I successfully pay and create a session
the DynamoDB record should have TTL set to 60 minutes from now
the session will auto-expire via DynamoDB TTL

name: AI Design Session Payment

description:
As an admin
  I want to manage customer orders
  So that I can process fulfillment and handle refunds

elements.name: View all orders with status filter

steps.name: I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I navigate to the admin order dashboard
I should see all orders sorted by date descending
I should be able to filter orders by status "paid", "processing", "shipped", "delivered"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there are orders with different statuses
I filter orders by status "paid"
I should only see orders with status "paid"
the query should use DynamoDB GSI2 with key "ORDER#STATUS#paid"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there is an order with ID "ORD456" and status "paid"
I update the order status to "processing"
the order status in DynamoDB should be updated to "processing"
the GSI2PK should be updated to "ORDER#STATUS#processing"
the order updatedAt timestamp should be refreshed

elements.name: Mark order as shipped with tracking number

steps.name: I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there is an order with ID "ORD456" and status "processing"
I update the order status to "shipped" with tracking number "1Z999AA10123456784"
the order status should be "shipped"
the tracking number should be saved in DynamoDB
a shipping notification email should be sent via SES
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there is an order with ID "ORD456" and status "shipped"
I update the order status to "delivered"
the order status should be "delivered"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there is an order with ID "ORD456" and status "paid"
I try to update the order status to "delivered"
I should see an error "Invalid status transition from paid to delivered"
the order status should remain "paid"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there is an order with ID "ORD789" and status "paid"
the order total is "$45.99"
I initiate a refund for order "ORD789"
a Stripe Refund should be created for the order payment
the order status should be updated to "refunded"
the stock should be restored for pre-designed items
the refund amount should be "$45.99"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
there is an order containing a custom design item
the customer paid a "$2.00" session fee
I process a refund for the order
only the order payment should be refunded
the session fee payment should NOT be refunded
the refund notes should state "Session fee non-refundable"
I am logged in as an admin via Cognito
I am logged in as a regular customer
I try to access the admin order dashboard
I should receive a 403 Forbidden response

name: Admin Order Management

description:
As a customer
  I want to view my order history
  So that I can track my purchases and their status

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have placed orders in the past
I navigate to the order history page
I should see a list of my orders sorted by date descending
each order should display order ID, date, status, total, and item count
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have placed orders in the past
I have an order with ID "ORD123"
I click on order "ORD123"
I should see the order detail page
I should see all order items with name, size, color, quantity, and price
I should see the shipping address
I should see the order totals breakdown
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have placed orders in the past
I have an order with status "shipped"
I view the order details
I should see the tracking number
I should see the status timeline showing "paid  processing  shipped"
I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have placed orders in the past
I have no previous orders
I navigate to the order history page
I should see "No orders yet"
I should see a link to browse products

elements.name: Order with custom design shows design image

steps.name: I am logged in as a customer via Cognito
I have placed orders in the past
I have an order containing a custom design item
I view the order details
I should see the custom design image from S3
the item should be labeled as "Custom Design"

name: Customer Order History

description:
As a platform operator
  I need API endpoints to respond quickly
  So that users have a good experience

elements.name: Product listing API responds within target latency

steps.name: the EpicWeave AWS serverless stack is deployed
Lambda functions are warmed up
I send GET request to "/products"
the response should complete within 500ms
the response should include CloudFront cache headers

elements.name: DynamoDB queries complete within target latency

steps.name: the EpicWeave AWS serverless stack is deployed
Lambda functions are warmed up
I query DynamoDB for user cart items
the query should complete within 100ms
it should use the correct partition key
the EpicWeave AWS serverless stack is deployed
Lambda functions are warmed up
a Lambda function has not been invoked recently
the function is invoked for the first time
the cold start latency should be under 2 seconds
subsequent invocations should be under 200ms
the EpicWeave AWS serverless stack is deployed
Lambda functions are warmed up
I request a product image from CloudFront
the image should be served within 200ms
it should come from the nearest edge location
the EpicWeave AWS serverless stack is deployed
Lambda functions are warmed up
100 concurrent requests hit "/products"
all requests should complete successfully
the P95 latency should be under 500ms
no requests should be throttled

name: API Response Time Performance
